definitions: very good or impressive in a fashionable or stylish way
relating to a man excessively concerned with appearance and fashion
examples: That's a dandy solution to our problem
We had a dandy time at the party
He wore a dandy suit with matching accessories
His dandy mannerisms made him stand out

definitions: disagreeably damp, humid, and cold with a musty smell
examples: The basement had a dank smell after flooding
We explored the dank cave with flashlights

definitions: neat and trim in dress and appearance, typically used of men
examples: He looked dapper in his tailored suit
The dapper gentleman tipped his hat politely

definitions: showing a reckless disregard for danger in pursuit of excitement
examples: His daredevil stunts amazed the crowd
She had a daredevil attitude toward extreme sports

definitions: willing to take risks or try difficult things with courage
examples: The daring rescue saved three lives
Her daring fashion choices always turned heads

definitions: made or having become dark or darker in color or light
made sad, angry, or troubled in mood or expression
examples: The darkened room helped him sleep better
Storm clouds darkened the afternoon sky
His darkened expression showed his disappointment
The news left her in a darkened mood

definitions: gradually becoming darker in color, light, or mood
examples: The darkening sky warned of approaching storms
His darkening thoughts worried his friends

definitions: having hopes or spirits suddenly destroyed or disappointed
marked or decorated with a dash or short line
examples: His dashed dreams left him feeling empty
Their dashed expectations led to new plans
The dashed line indicates where to cut
She wore a dashed pattern on her dress

definitions: attractively fashionable, confident, and full of energetic charm
examples: The dashing hero rescued the princess
He cut a dashing figure in uniform

definitions: wicked and cruel in a cowardly or treacherous way
examples: The villain's dastardly plan was finally exposed
His dastardly deeds caught up with him

definitions: able to be assigned a particular date or time period
considered attractive or suitable as a romantic partner
examples: The pottery shards are datable to 500 BCE
These documents are easily datable by watermarks
He's definitely datable with his charm and humor
She considers herself more datable after therapy

definitions: showing characteristics typical of an earlier time and no longer fashionable
examples: Her dated hairstyle looked like the 1980s
The dated technology couldn't run modern software

definitions: seeming difficult to deal with in anticipation; intimidating
examples: The daunting task took months to complete
Starting college can be daunting for students

definitions: showing fearlessness and determination despite danger or difficulty
examples: The dauntless explorer ventured into unknown territory
Her dauntless spirit inspired the whole team

definitions: unable to think or react properly due to shock or blow
examples: He looked dazed after the car accident
The dazed students struggled with the surprise test

definitions: temporarily blinded or confused by bright light
overwhelmed or impressed by something remarkable or skillful
examples: She was dazzled by the bright stage lights
The dazzled driver couldn't see the road
The audience was dazzled by her performance
He felt dazzled by her intelligence

definitions: extremely bright in a way that temporarily blinds or confuses
extremely impressive, beautiful, or skillful in a stunning way
examples: The dazzling sunlight reflected off the water
She wore a dress with dazzling sequins
His dazzling smile charmed everyone he met
The gymnast gave a dazzling performance

definitions: in a situation where no progress can be made due to disagreement
examples: The deadlocked negotiations lasted for weeks
The jury remained deadlocked after three days

definitions: deliberately impassive or expressionless, especially when being humorous
examples: His deadpan delivery made the joke funnier
She gave a deadpan response to criticism

definitions: wholly or partially unable to hear sounds
unwilling to listen or respond to something
examples: She has been deaf since birth
The deaf community uses sign language
He remained deaf to their pleas for help
The company was deaf to customer complaints

definitions: so loud as to make it impossible to hear anything else
examples: The deafening roar of the crowd filled the stadium
Construction created deafening noise all day

definitions: resembling or suggestive of death in appearance or manner
examples: A deathly silence fell over the room
Her face turned deathly pale with fear

definitions: reduced in quality, value, or character from a higher standard
examples: The debased currency lost most of its value
His debased behavior shocked former friends

definitions: open to discussion or argument; not definitely settled
examples: Whether it improved things is highly debatable
The debatable decision sparked heated discussions

definitions: making someone or something very weak and unable to function normally
examples: The debilitating illness kept her bedridden for months
Anxiety can have debilitating effects on performance

definitions: characterized by moral or cultural decline from excessive indulgence
luxuriously self-indulgent, especially regarding food or pleasure
examples: The decadent society ignored its problems
His decadent lifestyle led to bankruptcy
The decadent chocolate cake was worth every calorie
They enjoyed a decadent spa weekend

definitions: having had the head cut off or removed
examples: The decapitated statue was found in ruins
Police discovered a decapitated mannequin

definitions: having rotted or decomposed through natural processes or neglect
examples: The decayed wood crumbled at touch
Decayed teeth required immediate dental work

definitions: recently dead, used as a respectful way to refer to someone who died
examples: The deceased man's family gathered for the funeral
She inherited property from her deceased grandmother

definitions: guilty of or involving deceit; deliberately misleading or fraudulent
examples: His deceitful behavior ruined their friendship
The deceitful advertisement misled many customers

definitions: having authority or power distributed among several offices or locations rather than one
examples: The decentralised government gave regions more autonomy
Their decentralised network proved more resilient

definitions: having authority or power distributed among several offices or locations rather than one
examples: The decentralized system prevented single points of failure
Blockchain enables decentralized financial transactions

definitions: giving an appearance or impression different from the true one; misleading
examples: The pool's deceptive depth caused accidents
His deceptive calm masked inner turmoil

definitions: clear and definite in manner or quality; unquestionable
examples: She had a decided advantage in experience
There was a decided chill in the air

definitions: serving to determine or settle the final outcome of something
examples: He scored the deciding goal in overtime
The deciding factor was the price difference

definitions: shedding leaves annually, typically in autumn, as certain trees do
examples: Deciduous trees provide shade in summer
The deciduous forest looked bare in winter

definitions: relating to or using a system of numbers based on ten
examples: Convert the fraction to decimal form
The decimal system simplifies calculations

definitions: successfully converted from code or unclear form into normal language
examples: Scientists deciphered the ancient hieroglyphs
Her deciphered notes revealed important clues

definitions: able to make decisions quickly and effectively without doubt
settling an issue or producing a definite result
examples: Her decisive leadership saved the company
He took decisive action during the crisis
The decisive battle ended the long war
It was a decisive moment in history

definitions: making a statement or declaration rather than asking a question
examples: Write declarative sentences for your essay
Her declarative tone left no room for doubt

definitions: openly or formally announced, stated, or acknowledged
examples: The declared winner gave an acceptance speech
Their declared intentions proved to be false

definitions: officially declared no longer secret and made available to public
examples: The declassified documents revealed government secrets
Declassified files provided new historical insights

definitions: furnished or adorned with decorative items or features
awarded medals or honors for distinguished service or achievement
examples: The decorated Christmas tree sparkled with lights
She lived in a beautifully decorated apartment
The decorated veteran wore his medals proudly
Several decorated officers attended the ceremony

definitions: serving to make something look more attractive rather than functional
examples: The decorative pillows added color to the sofa
She chose decorative tiles for the bathroom

definitions: made smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree
examples: His decreased appetite worried his family
The decreased funding affected several programs

definitions: becoming smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree
examples: The decreasing temperature signaled winter's approach
Sales showed a decreasing trend this quarter

definitions: ordered or commanded by official decree or authoritative decision
examples: The decreed changes took effect immediately
The king's decreed laws were absolute

definitions: worn out or weakened by age, illness, or hard use
examples: The decrepit building was scheduled for demolition
His decrepit car barely ran anymore

definitions: devoted to a task, purpose, or cause with single-minded determination
formally devoted or set apart for a particular purpose or use
examples: She's a dedicated teacher who inspires students
The dedicated athlete trained every single day
The dedicated server handles only email traffic
They built a dedicated memorial for veterans

definitions: able to be deducted, especially from taxable income or insurance claims
examples: Charitable donations are often tax deductible
The deductible amount must be paid first
